trades.sentiment_summary: Edison International (EIX) reported strong Q3 2025 financial results, with earnings per share of $2.34 beating analyst estimates and revenues of $5.75 billion also exceeding expectations. Additionally, progress on regulatory fronts and wildfire fund access support the company's financial stability and growth outlook.

gpt5_reasoning:
Market is neutral with VIX ~20, so we favor high-momentum, liquid names and embrace volatility with disciplined 8%/16% brackets. Several current holdings show weak technicals and low composite proxies, so we’re rotating capital into stronger setups while keeping sector exposure balanced and respecting the 10% per-position cap. Financials and energy screens are strongest across our candidates; we’ll add two top-tier banks (WFC, CFG) and a high-momentum gas E&P (EQT), then diversify with UBER (growth/transport-tech), EIX (defensive utility with strong sentiment), and CTVA (agri-inputs).

We will close four underperformers (CCL, HPQ, FITB, GLW) and top up our best current leaders (IBKR, COP, ODFL, CARR) toward the 10% cap to increase capital efficiency. This plan deploys approximately 83% of freed capital today; given the 10% cap and score-based sizing on sub-65 composites, we’ll retain some dry powder to add on pullbacks or new signals within the next 1–3 sessions. Bracket orders on all buys: 8% stop-loss and 16% take-profit from entry.
